DIV.P: Termbase Entry Format - description of the internal format of entries in a Terminology Database.

Notes: Formatted text fields could contain HTML markup, but that markup has to be escaped (i.e., all XML special characters have to be replaced by character entities) so that the content looks like a simple text string to the XML parser.

AttributeType.name: Clink
AttributeType.description: Link to a concept (stored in the same database). The link target is an entrynumber.

AttributeType.name: Glink
AttributeType.description: Link to a graphics file (not stored in the database). The link target is a filename.

AttributeType.name: Plink
AttributeType.description: Link to a user (stored in a user database). The link target is the user name (user id).

AttributeType.name: Tlink
AttributeType.description: Link to a term (stored in the same database). The link target is "index:term".

AttributeType.name: Ulink
AttributeType.description: Link to a URL. The link target is specified in standard URL syntax.

ElementType.name: entry
ElementType.description: The root node of a terminology entry. An entry must contain at least one concept.

ElementType.name: conceptGrp
ElementType.description: The container for one concept. A concept has concept-level language-independent fields, and at least one language group which contains at least one term.

ElementType.name: concept
ElementType.description: Primary element of a conceptGrp. Content is the entry number.

ElementType.name: transac
ElementType.description: Contains a transaction type and responsible person. The type can be one of origination, modification, review, approval. The content of the tag is the textual representation of the associated person link (Plink), i.e., the person's user id.

AttributeType.name: type
AttributeType.description: A transac tag can be of type origination (the associated field has been created), modification (the associated field has been modified), review (the terms or concept has been reviewed), and approval (the term or concept has been approved).

ElementType.name: descripGrp
ElementType.description: Contains a descriptive element, and optionally a source, transactional info, and a note.

ElementType.name: descrip
ElementType.description: Contains a descriptive, free-text element like a definition or an explanation field. Content is formatted text, and the tag can carry a link attribute (link to concept, term, graphics file, URL).

ElementType.name: sourceGrp
ElementType.description: Contains a source reference, optionally a note and transactional info.

ElementType.name: source
ElementType.description: A source reference is either free text, or a link to a person or URL.

ElementType.name: note
ElementType.description: A general note. Contains formatted text with embedded cross-references.

ElementType.name: languageGrp
ElementType.description: The container for information about all terms in one language.

ElementType.name: language
ElementType.description: A language specifier. The type attribute holds the "name" of the language as specified in the database definition, the lang attribute holds the locale in the form "en_US".

ElementType.name: termGrp
ElementType.description: Groups one term and all its associated information, which can be descriptions, source references, notes, and transactional information.

ElementType.name: term
ElementType.description: Contains a term as plain text.
